dialogue: I heard Magnum condoms are basically, essentially, basically the same size as regular condoms.
Makes you think, what else do we believe just because of marketing? Like if you grew up being told the Book of Mormon was fake, you’d believe it was fake just because that’s what you were told.
Magnums are huge. My sister said her ex-husband had a scary big peen. Like frighteningly big. And they had to use Magnums.
Elephant trunk. That’s what she would call it.
I was watching this video. Not sure where I saw it. It was two people having intercourse, uh, sexual intercourse, uh -- -- SEX. And um, a cameraman filming them. An amateur porno-ography type thing?
Uh-huh. Paxton blushes, regretting even starting this story.

And the girl in the video was moaning really loudly, as is typical, I assume, in that type of video. Just screaming. And all the sudden off camera... Wait. Sorry, I forgot to establish - they're in a hotel room. Did I say that? These people are intercourse-ing each other, and filming, in a hotel room.

Okay, so they're banging. And she's moaning loudly, really into it... and then all of the sudden, off camera, in the hallway you hear this lady yell through the wall: "WE CAN HEAR YOU!!" And the couple stops sex-ing. And the look of embarrassment and horror on their faces is so painful. And the porno-ography girl who's taking it from behind-ish, says something defiant like, "good!" under her breath, but you can literally see her soul being sucked out of her body. Right then and there. All of her dignity gone, as if realizing for the first time... wow, this is my life, I'm f- ing a stranger on camera for money.
Why are you telling me this?
I guess, because... I felt, in that moment, “yeah”. We have souls. God’s real. It was a divine confirmation. Beat.
Do you watch a lot of...
It was just on social media, I’m not, a porno-ography-watcher, or something.
Anyway, I’m highly skeptical of the Magnum thing, because I’m positive people just believe what they’re told by marketing.
The investigator we’re supposed to meet is running late.
It’s a “he”. Um... His Christian name is unlisted.  I just hope this goes well. I know it’s not a competition, but I haven’t baptized a single investigator on my mission yet.
That’s not true, there was that hipster who worked at Urban Outfitters --
-- he was just doing it to be progressive. He only went to one sacrament meeting and stopped returning my calls after he Instagrammed about it.
Well, I’ve only converted like eight or nine people.
Eight or nine?! Anyway, what do you think about what I was saying?
Divine confirmation. Barnes takes a breath, looks away.
I don’t know. Guess I haven’t thought about it.
But you know it’s true, right?
You were grinding your teeth again.
Did you try waking me up?
My dentist says my teeth are fine. I was gonna buy a mouth guard before MTC prep, but I needed to donate to my cousin’s GoFundMe. She has a neurodegenerative disease.
Do you know which kind? My dad had something like that too.
I’m so sorry, is he okay?
Good afternoon, ma’am. My name is Sister Barnes. And this is my companion, Sister Paxton.
Are you interested in learning more about our savior Jesus Christ? The mom doesn’t say a word, just keeps walking.
Oh my gosh, they’re so pretty. I already love these girls.
I don’t know. That South Park musical kinda makes fun of us.
I downloaded some of the songs. They’re pretty funny actually.
It’s like having a lot of flab and being confused.
I don’t know. Sounds pretty great. Anyway. Who cares what other people think. You’re awesome.
Text from Sister Hall. She says we’re not supposed to be meeting this guy.
Maybe he’s outside the stake boundaries. Let me ask.
Now we have to meet him.
If I can convert the one guy no one else in the ward can convert... that would be HUGE for my salvation.
Alright, let’s get you a baptism.
My mother was a convert. So when my dad passed away, we auditioned a few different churches, just to see what’s out there, make sure we still believed it.
And now that you’ve been studying The Book of Mormon, how does it make you feel?
We won’t know if we’re comfortable until you ask. So maybe just ask?
If you don’t ask the question, I’m going to leave here wondering what we missed out on.

I know it may be difficult to imagine, but Polygamy was a spiritual mission needed at that time, in order to grow the ranks of our membership in the wake of much hardship and bloodshed. A man having plural wives meant more babies to help the community grow.
It’s yeah, it’s sketch, for sure, to our modern brains, but --
-- it was removed from the church not because it was “grotesque” or “controversial”, but because it was no longer necessary.
Okay: Burger King is better than Carl’s Jr --
Hardee’s on the East Coast. Burger King is better than Hardee’s which is better than Rally’s --

Checkers. Burger King is better than Hardees which is better than Checkers which is better than Wendy’s which is better than In & Out which is better than McDonalds which is better than Jack in the Box which is better than nothing.
But Jack in the Box serves breakfast all day.
right, okay, right, i don’t want to spook him, but let’s wrap this
nothing, let’s just politely wrap this and head back
he has our coats. the key to the bike lock is in my coat pocket
then we need to get our coats
walk back in the storm without coats and bikes? what is that, two miles?
okay, seems a little over the top, but...
maybe we ask him for help?
no could you fit through this?
or Elder Kennedy, just so they know where we are Paxton dials Kennedy but the phone won’t connect.
it’s the storm, keep trying okay we’ll ask for help
Mr. Reed? It’s not Mr. Reed.
Maybe if you unlock it, it will open?
I’m not sure. I don’t remember a hill, do you?
We walked up a hill, but I thought it plateaued in the back?
Are you asking us... for us to deliberate our belief in the church?
Is that a factor which corresponds to us going home?

Wow, Mr. Reed, you’ve introduced some very... interesting... points. I think we can admit that you are a very smart man, and that we still have a lot to learn. So with that, I will say, I would like to agree that you’re right, you’ve... convinced... us. And we would like to leave through the disbelief door and go home now. Ready, Sister Barnes?
Doesn’t matter what you say to him.
He’s not gonna let us go just because we admit he’s right.
Let’s just get out of here while our host is being gracious enough to let us leave.
I don’t see how we’re supposed to leave.
We open a door and leave.
But both doors lead to the same place, don’t they?
Then let’s leave through here. Let’s be honest and sincere, and let God decide what happens next.
Okay, we’re leaving now. Thank you for all of your mentorship. Thank you for letting us go home.
It’s okay. One step at a time. We’ll go slow.
You were right... ...all doors lead to Rome. Sister Barnes... there’s nothing. There’s no... it’s all blocked off... it’s all?!
...we should’ve went home it’s my fault we stayed...
...we didn’t have a choice. This entire encounter has been rigged to control us. None of this is our fault.
We made him angry. That’s why we’re still here, we made him --
No, that’s wrong. I think we’re still alive because we’ve challenged him.

I don’t know, I just have a feeling. This man has a genius level IQ. I’m scared of how smart he is. It’s likely he’s thought of every possible scenario. He’s going to be ten steps ahead of us. Which means from here on out... we must play our hand perfectly.
What do you think he wants?
Is he gonna keep us here forever?
He can’t. He’s too smart. He knows an Elder will check on us. And his address is in the church database. Which he would be prepared for, because he gave it to them to lure us here.
So, he knows time is against him. Which means he’ll have to let us go... Or kill us.
I don’t think he’s gonna let us go.
In the neck. As hard and as fast as you can. It has to be you. He’s watching me too closely. He won’t expect you to do it.
Let’s have a code word. Uh, if I say “Magic Underwear”. It means you stab.
Mrs. Reed? Can we help you?
But not until he opens the front door.
This is where he was. This is how we get out.
Look, the matches.  If we pull the rug through the door, the matches will come with.
Start a fire. Smoke out the speaking pipe in the basement. Make sure the Elder know we’re here.
No she’s in the same spot as before.
She was face down in the pie.
Sister, that’s not how I remember it, come on! Help!  Hold the sleeve up. I’ll get it started.
I saw it. She was dead. She was dead, Sister. We checked. There was a corpse. Did you see it too?
And I heard her... I heard her describe what she experienced on the other side.
